page.title: 03Farming
page.content: Most of the land in our area is used for farming.Cattle graze out on the moors. The farmers make silage for winter feed.They also make hay. Silage is made before hay making time.After the grass has been cut and gathered it is put into a silage pit. This is not really a pit but an enormous box.When it is full it is covered with a huge plastic sheet to keep the weather out.On top of the plastic sheet you put old tyres to weight it down. Hay making needs good weather.After the hay has been cut it has to be turned with a machine called a hay bob.Then the bailer comes along and gathers it up into bails tied with string.The bails have to be taken away to be stored.Loading up the trailer is very heavy work.
